page.title: 11Sportsmans Arms
page.content: The Sportsmans Arms has been a {drinking house}for about a hundred years.At one time the pub was{two {cottages,where farm workers lived.}The cottages were three or four hundred years old.The owner of the pub came about ten years ago when one end of the pub was a{garage}with petrol pumps outside.Being near holiday resorts the pub has a lot of tourists.{At one time there used to be{four rooms to let}but these were{very old fashioned}with few facilities. The{walls}of the Sportsmans Arms are {22 inches thick}and the{pub is 678 {feet above sea level.}It stands where the old Dartmouth-Totnes and Dittisham-Blackawton roads crossed. Nearby is an old{Home Guard pillbox and during World War 2 separate{field {hospitals}for{white and black U.S. {servicemen}were in adjacent fields.
